metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8121 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
DB_LOOKUP in nss_files/files-XXX.c in the Name Service Switch (NSS) in GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.21 and earlier does not properly check if a file is open, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) by performing a look-up on a database while iterating over it, which triggers the file pointer to be reset. Robin Hack discovered that the Name Service Switch (NSS) implementation in the GNU C Library did not properly manage its file descriptors. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (infinite loop).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8121` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.8').
